segments.text: I just can't get over the woman at the sink.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: She's completely oblivious to everything happening around her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is literally pouring over the sink's edge, onto her dress, and around her foot.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: How can someone be so engrossed in drying a single plate?
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It’s almost comical, if it weren’t so potentially damaging.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel a surge of frustration watching all that water go to waste.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Doesn't she hear the running water, or feel the puddle forming?
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: And the children, right behind her, are practically performing acrobatics for cookies.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: She's completely unaware of their little adventure.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It makes me wonder what other things she misses in her day.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I just want to shout out and alert her to the situation.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This level of detachment from reality is really something.
segments.speaker: PAR
